title: SM UB-34
text:
SM "UB-34" was a German <a href="German%20Type%20UB%20II%20submarine">Type UB II</a> <a href="submarine">submarine</a> or <a href="U-boat">U-boat</a> in the <a href="German%20Imperial%20Navy">German Imperial Navy</a> () during <a href="World%20War%20I">World War I</a>. The U-boat was ordered on 22 July 1915 and <a href="Ceremonial%20ship%20launching">launch</a>ed on 5 December 1915. She was <a href="Ship%20commissioning">commission</a>ed into the German Imperial Navy on 10 June 1916 as SM "UB-34".
"UB-34" sank 31 ships in 21 patrols. They included the <a href="Cory%20Environmental%23First%20World%20War">William Cory and Son</a> <a href="Collier%20%28ship%29">collier</a> SS "Hurstwood", which "UB-34" torpedoed and sank in the North Sea off <a href="Whitby">Whitby</a> on 5 February 1917.
The submarine served in the <a href="Training%20Flotilla">Training Flotilla</a> at the end of the war and was surrendered on 26 November 1918 in accordance with the requirements of the <a href="Armistice%20with%20Germany">Armistice with Germany</a>. "UB-34" was <a href="ship%20breaking">broken up</a> in <a href="Canning%20Town">Canning Town</a> in 1922.
Design.
A <a href="German%20Type%20UB%20II%20submarine">German Type UB II submarine</a>, "UB-34" had a displacement of when at the surface and while submerged. She had a total length of , a <a href="beam%20%28nautical%29">beam</a> of , and a <a href="draught%20%28ship%29">draught</a> of . The submarine was powered by two <a href="Karl%20Benz">Benz</a> six-cylinder diesel engines producing a total , two <a href="Siemens-Schuckert">Siemens-Schuckert</a> electric motors producing , and one <a href="propeller%20shaft">propeller shaft</a>. She was capable of operating at depths of up to .
The submarine had a maximum surface speed of and a maximum submerged speed of . When submerged, she could operate for at ; when surfaced, she could travel at . "UB-34" was fitted with two <a href="torpedo%20tube">torpedo tube</a>s, four torpedoes, and one <a href="8.8%20cm%20SK%20L/30%20naval%20gun">Uk L/30</a> <a href="deck%20gun">deck gun</a>. She had a <a href="Ship%27s%20company">complement</a> of twenty-one crew members and two officers and a 42-second dive time.
